result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsey T. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 109 DAYS time served.
Same conditions a probation except for condition time.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.

No Contact with  K. L. A., unless approved by BMCW, if BMCW/CHIPS not involved, to revert to No unsupervised contact without approval of the court. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

A course in anger management.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Cooperate with any CHIPS conditions.
Provide a DNA sample.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
FORTHWITH. First 4 MONTHS to be served as straight time, balance to be served with full Huber privileges.
Probation Review Hearing to be scheduled by DOC Agent with the court for 100 DAYS after release.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lindsey T. Anderson in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. Sentencing Hearing held with co-defendant's case 15CF1152, Robin Zwicky.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 109 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

*Serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, FORTHWITH. First 4 MONTHS to be served as straight time, balance to be served with full Huber privileges. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve an additional 100 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Cooperate with any CHIPS conditions.
-No Contact with  K. L. A., unless approved by BMCW, if BMCW/CHIPS not involved, to revert to No unsupervised contact without approval of the court. 
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Probation Review Hearing to be scheduled by DOC Agent with the court for 100 DAYS after release.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed:Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Lindsey T. Anderson in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Lindsey T. Anderson in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored, and provide a DNA sample. Court VACATED the Jury Trial date of 6/22/2015. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Lindsey T. Anderson not in court, in custody., not produced  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial.  Court down, defendant not produced. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing, Branch 23. Court ordered case be set prior to jury trial date. Jury trial remains scheduled for June 22, 2015.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Lindsey T. Anderson not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case called with co-defendant case 15CF1152. Both matters set for a Final Pretrial & Jury Trial date in branch 23.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Lindsey T. Anderson not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Case is co-defendant case, matter is adjourned for Scheduling with case 15CF1152 in branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand. (DEMAND FOR SPEEDY TRIAL REQUESTED AFTER DATE HAD BEEN PREVIOUSLY SET WITH CO-DEFENDANT'S CO-COUJNSEL.)

Defendant Lindsey T. Anderson in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Lindsey T. Anderson in custody.  Ron Dague for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-Defendant Robin Zwicky or KLA dob 12/21/14 unless as approved in a Children's Court order

Defendant Lindsey T. Anderson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Lindsey T. Anderson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
